description:
A component for truncating text content. > For best results, avoid using TruncateText inside parent containers that are inline (`display: inline/inline-block`) or that default to inline display (span, link, etc.). ### Single line ```javascript --- type: example ---
{lorem.paragraph()} {lorem.paragraph()} {lorem.paragraph()}
{ console.log(truncated, text) }} > Regular sized text with A Text Link and some bold text.
``` ### Multiple lines You can set the number of lines to display before truncation begins with the `maxLines` prop. Setting `maxLines` to `auto` will determine the number of lines that will fit. ```javascript --- type: example ---
{lorem.paragraph()} Read More Esse aliqua minim veniam duis consectetur non sunt ea deserunt qui cillum laboris officia. Minim nulla commodo dolore reprehenderit commodo occaecat veniam ad consectetur mollit consectetur partur consectetur eiusmod dolor incididunt incididunt. Read More

This line of text should be truncated from the middle of the string instead of the end.
@instructure/ui-elements/somefakedir/tomakethislonger/lib/longer/TruncateText
``` ### Using tooltips It's best practice to make the complete text of a truncated element available via a [Tooltip](Tooltip). ```js --- type: example --- const Example = (props) => { const [isTruncated, setIsTruncated] = useState(false) const handleUpdate = (newIsTruncated) => { if (isTruncated !== newIsTruncated) { setIsTruncated(newIsTruncated) } } const renderLink = () => ( {props.message} ) return ( {isTruncated ? ( document.getElementById('main')} > {renderLink()} ) : ( renderLink() )} ) } render( ) ``` ### Guidelines ```js --- type: embed --- ```

onUpdate.description: Callback when truncated text has changed

maxLines.description:
Number of lines to allow before truncating. `auto` will fit to parent.
Default is 1.

position.description: Where to place the ellipsis within the string. Default is 'end'

shouldTruncateWhenInvisible.description:
Force truncation of invisible elements (hack; will be removed in favor
of a better fix)

truncate.description: Add ellipsis after words or after any character. Default is 'character'

ellipsis.description: A string to use as the ellipsis

ignore.description: Characters to ignore at truncated end of string. Default is ' ', '.', ','
